questions.question: What is maximum nodes in binary tree height h?
questions.explanation: Maximum nodes in binary tree of height h = 2^(h+1) - 1.

questions.question: Binary tree requirement?
questions.explanation: Binary search tree requires sorted order: left < root < right.

questions.question: Which data structure is linear with pointer?
questions.explanation: Linked list is linear collection where each element points to next.

questions.question: Which follows FIFO principle?
questions.explanation: Queue follows FIFO: first element added is first removed.

questions.question: Common for implementing queue?
questions.explanation: Linked lists commonly implement queues for dynamic size management.

questions.question: Efficient for sorted data?
questions.explanation: Insertion sort is efficient for already sorted data with O(n) complexity.

questions.question: Best case quicksort?
questions.explanation: Best-case quicksort is O(n log n) with balanced partitioning.

questions.question: Which data structure implements LIFO?
questions.explanation: Stack implements LIFO: last element added is first removed.

questions.question: What manages virtual memory?
questions.explanation: Operating system manages virtual memory through page tables.

questions.question: Purpose of Wait-for graph?
questions.explanation: Wait-for graph detects deadlock by identifying circular waits.

questions.question: Multiple processes single-user term?
questions.explanation: Multitasking allows multiple processes to share single CPU.

questions.question: Process vs thread?
questions.explanation: Process is independent; thread is subset of process sharing memory.

questions.question: Synchronization in multiprocessor?
questions.explanation: Semaphores and mutexes prevent race conditions in shared resources.

questions.question: Preemptive scheduling algorithm?
questions.explanation: Round Robin is preemptive: each process gets time slice then preempted.

questions.question: Purpose of special processor?
questions.explanation: Special processors optimized for specific functions like GPU or crypto.

questions.question: Process after Kernel bootstrap?
questions.explanation: /etc/init.d scripts initialize system services.

questions.question: Direct access storage?
questions.explanation: Disk provides direct access to any location without sequential traversal.

questions.question: FIFO page replacement?
questions.explanation: FIFO replaces oldest page first in memory management.

questions.question: In fork() system call?
questions.explanation: fork() creates new child process separate from parent.

questions.question: Memory categories?
questions.explanation: Two memory categories: primary (RAM) and secondary storage.

questions.question: Atomicity property ensures?
questions.explanation: Atomicity ensures transaction either completes fully or not at all.

questions.question: Full binary tree leaves?
questions.explanation: In full binary tree, leaves = internal nodes + 1.

questions.question: Complexity DFS?
questions.explanation: DFS has O(V+E) or O(n) complexity visiting each node once.

questions.question: Which attribute AGE?
questions.explanation: AGE is single-valued attribute: one value per person.

questions.question: What stack property use?
questions.explanation: Stack uses LIFO: last pushed element popped first.

questions.question: Not transaction property?
questions.explanation: Concurrency is not transaction property; ACID properties are Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability.

questions.question: Deque allows?
questions.explanation: Deque allows insertion and deletion at both ends.

questions.question: Graph traversal BFS?
questions.explanation: BFS uses queue for level-by-level traversal.

questions.question: Merge sort complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge sort has O(n log n) complexity in all cases.

questions.question: Shortest path algorithm?
questions.explanation: Dijkstra finds shortest path in weighted graphs.

questions.question: After project idea?
questions.explanation: Design phase defines specifications and architecture before development.

questions.question: Waterfall for?
questions.explanation: Waterfall is oldest approach for software engineering development.

questions.question: Spiral model feature?
questions.explanation: Spiral model prominently features risk management in each iteration.

questions.question: Model difficult to maintain?
questions.explanation: Waterfall's rigid sequential structure makes maintenance difficult.

questions.question: Quality management consist?
questions.explanation: Quality management includes SQA (assurance) and SQM (measurement).

questions.question: Dummy activity?
questions.explanation: Dummy activity shows logical relationship without consuming time.

questions.question: UML diagram for flow?
questions.explanation: Activity diagram models flow of control or data in system.

questions.question: Association represents?
questions.explanation: Association represents relationship between classes in UML.

questions.question: OOD process first step?
questions.explanation: First step of OOD is object-oriented analysis.

questions.question: Object-oriented analysis purpose?
questions.explanation: OOA identifies objects, defines requirements, and models system.

questions.question: Three phases of OO dev?
questions.explanation: OO development has three phases: OO analysis, OO design, OO programming.

questions.question: Search problem components?
questions.explanation: Key components: initial state, successor function, goal path, goal test.

questions.question: Not correct testing technique?
questions.explanation: Collaboration is not testing technique; correct types are unit, integration, system testing.

questions.question: UML diagram for requirements?
questions.explanation: Use case diagrams facilitate requirements gathering and user interactions.

questions.question: General purpose organizing element?
questions.explanation: Package is general mechanism for organizing elements into groups.

questions.question: Not AI application?
questions.explanation: Database Management Systems are not AI applications.

questions.question: Incremental model?
questions.explanation: Incremental combines linear sequencing with waterfall method.

questions.question: RAD stands for?
questions.explanation: RAD = Rapid Application Development methodology.

questions.question: RMI communication?
questions.explanation: RMI (Remote Method Invocation) uses stub/skeleton with remote objects.

questions.question: Software testing NOT correct?
questions.explanation: Collaboration testing doesn't exist; valid types are unit, integration, system.

questions.question: Modular decomposition?
questions.explanation: Modular decomposition develops modules from subsystems.

questions.question: Sequence diagram vertical line?
questions.explanation: Vertical line in sequence diagram represents time progression.

questions.question: What ensures impact reduction?
questions.explanation: Risk avoidance, mitigation, and contingency all reduce impact.

questions.question: MARR numerical value?
questions.explanation: MARR can be equal, less, or greater than IRR depending on project.

questions.question: Software macroscopic schedule?
questions.explanation: Software macroscopic schedule distributes effort and allocates tasks across duration.
